div.div: Sociologic perspective: territory, mutuality, group identity
8 Subsystems: housing, safety, health, education, economics, politics, communication, recreation
COLDSPA: Character, Onset, Location, Duration, Severity, Pattern, Associated factors
Vital Stats: at avg vs. high teen births, STIs, accidents
Physical Environment: safe housing, disaster-prepared vs. homelessness, unprepared
Health & Social Services: accessible vs. distant/limited
Safety: adequate police/fire vs. crime/poor EMS
Education: adequate funding, school nurse vs. high dropout, no nurse
Government: responsive, high turnout vs. apathetic
Recreation: diverse, accessible vs. limited → isolation, gangs
Infant Mortality (Top 5, 2018): birth defects, preterm/LBW, maternal complications, SIDS, injuries
Ages 1–4: injury, anomalies, homicide, cancer, pneumonia
Ages 15–24: injury, suicide, homicide, cancer, heart disease
Ages 65+: heart disease, cancer, chronic resp, stroke, Alzheimer’s
Small, outdated safety services, no EMTs
Opportunity: expand nursing facility, leverage civic voice
Risk: poor coping (poverty, unemployment), weak EMS
Actual: no school nurse, no hospital, full LTC
Collaborative Problem: RC: post-traumatic community stress disorder
Validate: compare subjective vs. objective, confirm with leaders
Situation: rural, no hospital/EMS, no school nurse
Recommendation: expand LTC, hire school nurse, improve EMS
